definition: to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat

sentences.english: She tore ligament in her ankle while she was playing squash.
sentences.chinese: 她在打壁球时把踝部韧带拉伤了。

sentences.english: Pulled muscles and twisted ankles are the downside of sports and exercise.
sentences.chinese: 运动和训练中拉伤肌肉和扭伤关节已呈下降趋势。

sentences.english: I tore my muscle quite bad and it took me up to now to recover and get fit.
sentences.chinese: 我把肌肉拉伤得很厉害，这让我直到现在才康复。

sentences.english: It targets you inner most abdominal muscle , the transverse abdominis.
sentences.chinese: 它的目标你内心最腹部肌肉拉伤，横向腹直肌。

sentences.english: The French midfielder, replaced in the 39th minute, has strained the biceps femoris muscle in his right leg.
sentences.chinese: 达科特则因为拉伤了右腿二头肌而在39分钟被换下。

sentences.english: Can you strain or over exert?
sentences.chinese: 你会拉伤或过度用力吗？

sentences.english: Injuries mainly included joint ligament sprain and muscle sprain.
sentences.chinese: 损伤主要为关节韧带扭伤和肌肉拉伤。

sentences.english: John stood down during the competition for pulling his muscle.
sentences.chinese: 约翰因肌肉拉伤而中途退出了比赛。

sentences.english: The most common injury is muscle strain, Spang said.
sentences.chinese: 斯潘说最为常见的伤是肌肉拉伤。

sentences.english: He strained his muscle in the match.
sentences.chinese: 他在那次比赛中拉伤了肌肉。

sentences.english: And Essien had recovered sufficiently from a calf strain to join in the session.
sentences.chinese: 而埃辛也从小腿拉伤中完全复原，重新加入了训练中。

sentences.english: I pulled a muscle in my leg and l hobbled all the way .
sentences.chinese: 我的腿部肌肉拉伤了，是一瘸一拐地走着来的。

sentences.english: Objective To observe the effect of hamstring muscle injury treated by pole vaulting .
sentences.chinese: 目的观察电针为主治疗股后肌群拉伤的效果。

sentences.english: However, Bridge tweaks his knee ligaments and has to have treatment.
sentences.chinese: 布里奇由于膝盖韧带拉伤正在接受治疗。

sentences.english: Sprain and strain is caused by overstretching.
sentences.chinese: 扭伤和拉伤都是由过度伸展导致。

sentences.english: He suffered a pulled calf muscle.

definition: knee/(Internet slang) to kneel down (in admiration)
to sustain injuries/wounded (in an accident etc)/harmed
